main event: A bright stationary light was observed moving in a straight line and suddenly disappeared in Traverse City, Michigan on October 9, 1955.
interesting points: The object was observed for 1 hour, from 2200 to 0300Z.
Arcturus sets at the disappearance of the object, suggesting it might be a celestial object.
The report lacked details on color, shape, size, duration, and direction of motion of the object.
The observer(s) were considered reliable to the best of their ability.
The report was ultimately classified as insufficient data to formulate an opinion, and the case was closed.
